examples: in the hollow of a tree

definition: a depressed or low part of a surface, a small valley or basin
having an indentation or inward curve : concave, sunken
having an unfilled or hollowed-out space within
lacking in real value, sincerity, or substance : false, meaningless
examples: a victory over a weakling is hollow and without triumph

definition: reverberating like a sound made in or by beating on a large empty enclosure : muffled
examples: heard a hollow sound when he knocked on the wall

definition: to remove the inside of : to make hollow (see hollow entry 2)
to form by removing the inside of something : to form by making something hollow
examples: rain barrels hollowed out from trees

definition: so as to have a hollow (see hollow entry 2 sense 4) sound, in a way that reflects a lack of real value, sincerity, or substance
examples: The sound echoed hollow in the cave.
an ongoing story that has the old cowboy-and-Indians genre beat hollow
